info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A NARROW BAND OF LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE TO AFFECT PARTS OF NEW HAVEN, FAIRFIELD, MIDDLESEX AND EASTERN SUFFOLK COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A narrow band of light snow showers accompanied by winds of up to 35 mph. Visibility down to one mile at times. An additional few tenths of an inch of snow is possible in this band. Motorists are advised to use extra caution this morning as untreated roads will be snow and ice covered. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 741 AM EDT, a northwest to southeast oriented narrow band of snow was nearly stationary across New Haven and eastern Suffolk Counties. This band should continue to weaken through 9am. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... New Haven, Waterbury, Danbury, Meriden, Milford, Middletown, Wallingford, Shelton, Naugatuck, Guilford, Southold, Southbury, Wolcott, Clinton and Old Saybrook. SAFETY INFO... Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
